info.name: METAADS
info.description:
Business Managers are a way for Meta to associate assets that include ad accounts, the Meta Pixel, business users, ad activity, and more to a business. Meta expects to use Business Managers as a container to represent a business.

The 2-Tier Business Manager solution is a scalable solution for a Business Manager to create and manage child businesses, and allows you to:

- Create and delete hundreds or thousands of small Business Managers (Child Business Managers) underneath a Parent Business Manager.
    
- Create a small business presence.
    
- Create assets for the user.
    
- Offer Facebook ads to your end user on your website or platform.
    

EndFragment

Read More at - [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/2tier-bm-solution/](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/2tier-bm-solution/)

item.name: 2-Tier ads

formdata.description:
Optional parameter but needed if you want to publish ads promoting this page
Note: the user must be an admin of the BM that owns this page if this page is owned
Optional, depending on your app's security settings

request.description:
- **Headers**:
    
    - `Authorization: Bearer`
        
        - The **authorization token** required to authenticate the request.
            
        - `EAALXBdIwKjQBA...` is the **long-lived access token** that grants access to the Facebook API.
            
- **Form Data**:
    
    - `id`: `"1215672488927258"`
        
        - This is the **parent Business Manager ID** under which the new child BM will be created.
            
    - `name`: `"Test Child BM 02"`
        
        - This is the **name of the new child Business Manager** to be created. In this case, the name is `"Test Child BM 02"`.
            
    - `vertical`: `"OTHER"`
        
        - This specifies the **vertical (or industry)** of the new child BM. It can be one of the following options depending on the business type: `"ADVERTISING_AGENCY"`, `"AUTOMOTIVE"`, `"CONSUMER_PACKAGED_GOODS"`, `"ECOMMERCE"`, `"ENTERTAINMENT_AND_MEDIA"`, `"GAMING"`, `"FINANCIAL_SERVICES"`, etc.
            
        - Here, `"OTHER"` is used, indicating a general or undefined vertical.
            
    - `shared_page_id`: `"286772371178056"`
        
        - This is the **Facebook Page ID** that will be shared with the new child BM. The page associated with this ID will be linked to the new BM and can be managed through it.
            
    - `page_permitted_tasks`: `["MANAGE", "CREATE_CONTENT", "MODERATE", "MESSAGING", "ADVERTISE", "ANALYZE"]`
        
        - These are the **permissions or tasks** allowed for the shared Facebook page under the new child BM.
            
        - Permissions include:
            
            - `"MANAGE"`: Full control over the Page, including settings and roles.
                
            - `"CREATE_CONTENT"`: Ability to post content on behalf of the Page.
                
            - `"MODERATE"`: The ability to moderate comments and reviews.
                
            - `"MESSAGING"`: Ability to manage Page messaging (e.g., responding to messages).
                
            - `"ADVERTISE"`: Ability to run ads for the Page.
                
            - `"ANALYZE"`: Ability to view Page Insights and performance metrics.
                
    - `timezone_id`: `"1"`
        
        - This is the **timezone ID** for the new child BM. Each number represents a specific timezone. In this case, `1` refers to **GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)**.
            
    - `access_token`: `"EAALXBdIwKjQBOzWazYXgcWrZAkXiJZCdIQQzAGhwslBWJvUUiTgoTFCDjJOwtGOZBApe5uMtcpouTDpJh2CkAnmi2rTZBvI"`
        
        - This is the **access token** used for authenticating the request. It should be a valid token with sufficient permissions to create a child BM under the parent BM.

formdata.description:
Optional parameter but needed if you want to publish ads promoting this page
Note: the user must be an admin of the BM that owns this page if this page is owned
Optional, depending on your app's security settings

request.description:
- `client_id`: `"916119000223951"`
    
    - This is the **client ID** that uniquely identifies the application making the API request.
        
    - In this case, the client ID is `916119000223951`, which likely refers to the app or integration linked with this Business Manager operation.
        
- `access_token`: `"EAALXBdIwKjQBAIXQE31QKnKQ72lzRH9HseTNxnXPOvsTALamWMkqjTPalttMKuXQOnD6P7MTdMCzYnp"`
    
    - This is the **access token** used to authenticate the request. The access token grants the application or user permissions to perform this action (deleting an owned business).
        
    - Make sure the token has sufficient scope and permissions to perform delete operations on Business Manager resources.

- **name**:
    
    - The name of the **owned business**.
        
    - Example: `"Test Child BM 02"`
        
- **vertical**:
    
    - The **industry** or **business vertical** of the owned business.
        
    - Common verticals include: `RETAIL`, `E_COMMERCE`, `OTHER`, etc.
        
    - Example: `"vertical": "OTHER"`
        
- **relationship**:
    
    - Describes the **relationship** between the parent **Business Manager** and the **owned business**.
        
    - Example: `"relationship": "client"` or `"relationship": "partner"`
        
- **shared_page**:
    
    - The **Facebook Page** that is shared or linked with the owned business.
        
    - This is useful for identifying the public-facing entity of the business.
        
    - Example: `"shared_page": "286772371178056"`
        
- **page_permitted_tasks**:
    
    - Lists the **tasks** the owned business can perform on the linked/shared page.
        
    - Permitted tasks may include:
        
        - `MANAGE`: Can manage the page (e.g., update info, add admins).
            
        - `CREATE_CONTENT`: Can post and create content on the page.
            
        - `MODERATE`: Can moderate content (e.g., respond to comments).
            
        - `ADVERTISE`: Can run ads associated with the page.
            
        - `ANALYZE`: Can view page insights and analytics.
            
    - Example: `"page_permitted_tasks": ["MANAGE", "CREATE_CONTENT", "MODERATE", "ADVERTISE", "ANALYZE"]`

response.name: Get a Child Business Manager

item.name: Fetch the line of credit ID and share with child Business Manager

request.description:
**receiving_business_id**:

- The **ID** of the Business Manager that is the **recipient** of the line of credit.
    
- This should be the **child Business Manager** that will receive credit allocation from the **parent Business Manager**.
    
- **access_token**:
    
    - An **authentication token** that has sufficient permissions to **manage line of credit allocations** and other finance-related actions within Business Manager.
        
    - The token should be associated with a user who has financial permissions on the **parent Business Manager** (owning the line of credit).

response.name: Fetch the line of credit ID and share with child Business Manager
